intro: Eleocharis japonica var. major, commonly known as the Japanese spike-rush, is a flowering plant native to East Asia. It is a member of the Cyperaceae family, characterized by its grass-like appearance and rhizomatous growth habit. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that contain numerous tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. It typically grows in wetland habitats such as marshes, pond edges, and disturbed soils. Due to its adaptability, it is often found in both natural and human-altered environments.
